alert.note: Alert for Dallam; Deaf Smith; Hartley; Moore; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 10 at 8:23PM CDT until April 11 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND THE WESTERN HALF OF THE TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND THE WESTERN HALF OF THE TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...RED FLAG WARNING HAS EXPIRED FOR THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND THE WESTERN HALF OF THE TEXAS PANHANDLE... * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron. In Texas...Dallam... Sherman...Hartley...Moore...Oldham...Potter...Deaf Smith... Randall and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...For Monday, south to southwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gust up to 40 mph. For Tuesday, southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent Monday and as low as 7 percent Tuesday. * Red Flag Threat Index...2 to 5 Monday and 6 to 8 on Tuesday. * Timing...From 1 PM to 9 PM Monday and from 11 AM to 10 PM on Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.

area.areaDesc: Dallam; Deaf Smith; Hartley; Moore; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall; Sherman
